moves.1. e4 e5 2. d4: Center game. After ...exd4, c3 dxc3, Bc4 cxb2, Bxb2. White has a lead in development.
moves.2... Nc6: Best for black is to accept the pawns.
moves.3. dxe5 Nxe5 4. Nc3 d6 5. Bb5+: I do not fear c6 as it weakens the d-pawn.
moves.5... Bd7 6. Bxd7+ Nxd7: Capture with the queen is better. This inactivates the knight.
moves.9... Ngf6: He falls for it. Now I jump into the drivers seat.
moves.17... b5 18. Be5: I drive the knight away from the potential fork on d5.
moves.18... Ng4 19. f4 b4 20. Nd5 Rad8: Now I wonder how to defend the back rank threat.
moves.21. h3 Nxe5 22. Rxe5 f6: ?? Now I penetrate into his king's fortress with mate.
moves.23. Ree7: Daring him to take the knight.
moves.24. Rexg7 Rxd5: There was no way to prevent mate.
moves.25. Rgh7+ Kg8 26. Rcg7#: That is why you should avoid at all cost letting your opponent get his rooks on the seventh.
